results.title: Long-Term Incidence of Stroke and Dementia in ASCOT
results.text_hl: The @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@-based BP-lowering regimen compared with the @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@-based regimen significantly reduced all @<m>DISEASE_Stroke</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@ (HR, 0.77 [95% CI, 0.66-0.89]; P=0.0003) after a median follow-up of 5.5 years.

citations.NLM: Whiteley WN, Gupta AK, Godec T, Rostamian S, Whitehouse A, Mackay J, Sever PS. Long-Term Incidence of Stroke and Dementia in ASCOT Stroke. 2021 Oct;52(10):3088-3096. PMID: 34192893
citations.BibTeX: @article{34192893, title={Long-Term Incidence of Stroke and Dementia in ASCOT}, author={Whiteley WN and Gupta AK and Godec T and Rostamian S and Whitehouse A and Mackay J and Sever PS}, journal={Stroke}, volume={52}, number={10}, pages={3088-3096}}

results.title: Medications for Hypertension Change the Secretome Profile from Marrow Stromal Cells and Peripheral Blood Monocytes
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ had no effect on secretome in cocultures with @<m>DISEASE_Stroke</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@-Mo (Figure 3).

citations.NLM: Satani N, Giridhar K, Cai C, Wewior N, Norris DD, Aronowski J, Savitz SI. Medications for Hypertension Change the Secretome Profile from Marrow Stromal Cells and Peripheral Blood Monocytes Stem Cells Int. 2020;2020():8894168. PMID: 32802081
citations.BibTeX: @article{32802081, title={Medications for Hypertension Change the Secretome Profile from Marrow Stromal Cells and Peripheral Blood Monocytes}, author={Satani N and Giridhar K and Cai C and Wewior N and Norris DD and Aronowski J and Savitz SI}, journal={Stem Cells Int}, volume={2020}, pages={8894168}}

results.title: Effects of Blood Pressure Lowering Agents on Cardiovascular Outcomes in Weight Excess Patients: A Systematic Review and Meta-analysis.
results.text_hl: Comparisons of two classes of drugs with at least two studies indicated that (1) CCB and ACEI increased the risk of @DISEASE_Heart_Failure @DISEASE_MESH:D006333 @@@HF@@@ [relative risk (RR) = 2.26; 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.16-4.40] and @<m>DISEASE_Stroke</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@ [hazard ratio (HR) = 1.13; 1.00-1.26]), respectively, compared to diuretics; and (2) CCB showed a reduction in @<m>DISEASE_Stroke</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@ (HR = 0.77; 0.66-0.89) and total mortality (HR = 0.94; 0.87-1.01) compared to the BB @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Francischetti EA, de Abreu VG, da Silva Figueiredo LF, Dezonne RS, Coutinho ESF. Effects of Blood Pressure Lowering Agents on Cardiovascular Outcomes in Weight Excess Patients: A Systematic Review and Meta-analysis. Am J Cardiovasc Drugs. 2020 Oct;20(5):447-470. PMID: 31898196
citations.BibTeX: @article{31898196, title={Effects of Blood Pressure Lowering Agents on Cardiovascular Outcomes in Weight Excess Patients: A Systematic Review and Meta-analysis.}, author={Francischetti EA and de Abreu VG and da Silva Figueiredo LF and Dezonne RS and Coutinho ESF}, journal={Am J Cardiovasc Drugs}, volume={20}, number={5}, pages={447-470}}

results.title: Reduced total mortality and death from myocardial infarction and stroke in moderate/severe hypertensives treated with "Tenormin" (atenolol).
results.text_hl: Reduced total mortality and @DISEASE_Death @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@death@@@ from @DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@myocardial infarction@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Stroke</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@ in moderate/severe @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensives@@@ treated with "@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Tenormin@@@" (@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@).

citations.NLM: Cruickshank JM. Reduced total mortality and death from myocardial infarction and stroke in moderate/severe hypertensives treated with "Tenormin" (atenolol). Drugs Exp Clin Res. 1990;16(3):133-6. PMID: 2387213

results.title: Atenolol in hypertension: is it a wise choice?
results.text_hl: @<m>DISEASE_Stroke</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@Stroke@@@ was also more frequent with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ treatment.

results.title: Interaction between nifedipine and atenolol: pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics in normotensive volunteers.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ significantly decreased systolic and diastolic blood pressure as well as heart rate; @<m>DISEASE_Stroke</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@ volume index following exercise increased significantly, and cardiac index was unchanged.

citations.NLM: Rosenkranz B, Ledermann H, Frölich JC. Interaction between nifedipine and atenolol: pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics in normotensive volunteers. J Cardiovasc Pharmacol. 1986 Sep-Oct;8(5):943-9. PMID: 2429095

results.title: Atenolol vs nonatenolol beta-blockers for the treatment of hypertension: a meta-analysis.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ is associated with increased @<m>DISEASE_Stroke</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@ in the elderly but whether this extends to nonatenolol beta-blockers remains uncertain.

citations.NLM: Kuyper LM, Khan NA. Atenolol vs nonatenolol beta-blockers for the treatment of hypertension: a meta-analysis. Can J Cardiol. 2014 May;30(5 Suppl):S47-53. PMID: 24750981
